generalInfo:
Northern Thailand offers a peaceful escape from the typical tourist routes, immersing you in the region’s natural beauty and rich cultural heritage. This ten-day adventure takes you through misty mountains, serene temples, vibrant markets, and charming villages, offering a deeper connection to Thailand’s roots.

Your journey begins in Chiang Rai, a tranquil town known for its iconic White Temple and the exquisite Doi Tung Royal Villa, where lush gardens and panoramic valley views create a perfect introduction to the region. As you explore the Golden Triangle, where Thailand, Laos, and Myanmar converge, you’ll gain insight into the area’s complex history while drifting down the Mekong River, surrounded by timeless landscapes.

A standout experience is the time spent in Pai, a picturesque town nestled in rice paddies and rolling hills. Here, you’ll visit hidden waterfalls, soak in natural hot springs, and enjoy the slower pace of rural life. The charm of Pai is in its simplicity—its serene setting offers a welcome contrast to busier cities.

You’ll also engage with the hill tribes of Mae Hong Son, including the Long-Neck Karen, who continue to preserve their unique traditions. This visit offers a meaningful cultural exchange, providing insight into their way of life while helping sustain these communities.

Northern Thailand’s temples are a highlight of the journey, with the modern artistry of Wat Rong Khun in Chiang Rai and the ancient splendor of Wat Phra Singh in Chiang Mai standing out. Each temple tells a story, offering moments of reflection and beauty.

A visit to the Elephant Nature Park Chiang Mai provides an ethical way to interact with elephants. It’s a memorable experience that emphasises conservation and respect for these majestic creatures.

As you traverse the scenic landscapes of Doi Inthanon National Park, home to Thailand’s highest peak, you’ll be surrounded by stunning waterfalls, lush forests, and the cool, refreshing air of the mountains. The journey’s relaxed pace allows you to truly soak in the beauty and tranquility of Northern Thailand.

This trip is ideal for those who want to experience Thailand beyond the usual tourist spots, discovering its hidden gems, rich history, and serene natural landscapes. Northern Thailand invites you to slow down, connect with its culture, and savour every moment of the journey.

dayInfo.description: Chiang Rai arrival On arrival Chiang Rai airport, your guide will welcome and take you to your hotel. The rest of the day will be free on leisure. You’ll spend the night in Chiang Rai.

Chiang Rai – Doi Tung – Mae Sai – Chiang Saen – Chiang Rai After breakfast, we will depart to visit "Doi tung Palace " or " King’s mother garden ” the palace in the big beautiful valley which has a huge garden with more varieties of flowers. In the place, see the main hall where the people can show their respect to the photos of the Princess mother or the King's mother. You can also see silk embroidering in the name of the flowers which start from the English alphabet and the beautiful painting which can change the color and light while you're walking from one corner to the other corner. Enjoy the lovely view point from the palace balcony with the view of the garden and mountains' view. You can enjoy walking in the garden and take a photo of the statue called “The continuity " right in the middle of the garden. After that continue to Mae Sai, the northern most point of Thailand where you can see the border between Thailand and Burma called “ Tha Khee Lek " the trading place for the Thai, Burmese and Chinese with many difference kinds of product. Then visit the Golden Triangle area where once used to be the opium trade area. Here is a chance to go on Mae Khong River by the river boat ride to our neighbourhood, Laos and see the beautiful scenery along the giantic Mae Khong River which divide the three countries from each other before the returning back to the main land Chiang Rai and overnight stay in Chiang Rai.

Chiang Rai city tour – Thaton Breakfast. In Chiang Rai, you are in the northern reaches of Thailand. A wooded, mountainous and beautiful. This morning, visit the city of Chiang Rai. You will start with a walk in the heart of the local market, where locals come to sell and buy their vegetables and fruit in the morning. Then you visit the Wat Phra Kaew temple the superb museum Rai Mae Fah Luang. Visit the white temple, Wat Rong Khun. It nevertheless very recent temple is the most visited monument in the region, the work of Thai artist Chalermchai Kositpipat, started in 1997. Its creator himself announces that he will only be completed 60 to 90 years after his death. Its uniqueness, its whiteness, making it a unique temple of its kind. In wihaan a fresco mixing Buddhist codes with Matrix, Star Wars, the bombing of the Twin Towers in New York and even Kung Fu Panda stands out from the usual decorations such monuments. You’ll be check out by noon and lunch will be on own. In the afternoon, head to Thaton Area. Visiting Thaton temple up the mountain with the beautiful overview of Kok River from Myanmar with 78 kms through Thailand. Then check in and overnight at Thaton.

Thaton – Chiang Dao – Pai Check out from the hotel and leaving to Chiang Dao Area, visit Chiang Dao Temple cave where once it used to be the cave where the soldier troops of Myanmar stopped for resting before attacked Chiang Mai in 1500s. See the starlactite and starlacmite from lime stone in different forms and sizes in the cave. After lunch (by your own account) , continue the trip to Pai, a small town in Maehongson province. Stop at Mae Malai village where there is a market with all the most featured products of Thailand. Drive through Mork Fah Waterfall one of the waterfall that falls 60 meters and flows all year round. Have a walk trough the shady, forest trail to the falls and see the fog floating around the setting given its name. Then you'll stop at Pong Deuid, one of the most beautiful hot springs in the province of Chiang Mai. This Spa is little exploited commercially, in fact, and is part of a well maintained in a very picturesque wooded Valley Park. Downstream of bubbling geysers, the rock formations are shallow pools where you can have a nice swim. Arrive in Pai in the evening. Overnight at the hotel.

Pai – Mae Hong Son Pick up at your hotel and we then embark on a cruise for sightseeing along the Pai River and have chance to observe the most beautiful scenery and simple life style. Drop in to visit Long- Necked Karen village, the women in this tribal village wear their one brass winding rings on their necks. Interact with tribal village makes them can keep and prolong their unique culture and tradition for years long. Afternoon, our journey will lead you to Wat Phra That Doi Kong Mu, is located on the outskirts of Mae Hong Son town at the top of Kong Mu Hill. It is reached either by road or by a long staircase for the bravest. From the hilltop you can see entirely a beautiful nature of the town which surrounded by mountains and valleys. We then continue to visit Jong Kham and Jong Klang temples. These two temples share the same area right next to the big swamp. They both are old temples consist of beautiful Burmese style edifices which put up the holy Buddha image. You’ll spend the night in Mae Hong Son.

Mae Hong Son Morning after breakfast, we will first visit to Tham Lod Cave by bamboo raft, home to large numbers of bats and swifts and are filled with stalactites and stalagmites. After the arrival, take a walk to see the raft man in front of the cave entrance, who is going to bring you in by the bamboo rafting inside the cave. Afternoon, we will visit the Lahu Hill Tribe village. Their main occupation is agriculture such as rice farming, and corn planting; raising animals for consumption besides, Lahu are still the most famous in hunter. Come to this village to watch their still primitive lifestyle. Our next village is Lisu Hill Tribe village, are very famous in sewing, embroidery, making silverware. The outstanding point of Lisu is a woman’s dress which has the most beautiful bright colors and catching the eyes of all hill tribes in Mae Hong Son province. Transfer back to your hotel for your overnight.

Mae Hong Son – Mae Chaem – Chiang Mai After breakfast, around 7 a.m, you will visit the local market and departure for Chiang Mai via Mae Chaem. Along the way, we pass through the Doi Inthanon National Park, which is rich in plant and animal species, especially birds, and some ethnic minorities live there. Stop to visit some of the most beautiful waterfalls in Chiang Mai province.Arrive in Chiang Mai in the evening. Overnight at Hotel.

Chiang Mai Orientation After breakfast, we have a walking tour to the old town. You will see the most beautiful temples of Chiang Mai including of Wat Phra Singh temple, Wat Phan Tao, Wat Chedi Luang Wat Phra Singh is one of the most sacred temples in Chiang Mai with Lanna style architecture. And it is well-known for the name”The temple of the Lion Buddha”. We then continue to Wat Phan Tao, an ancient temple with beautiful garden area sitting right next to the sacred Wat Chedi Luang in Chiang Mai town. Next to Wat Phan Tao is Wat Chedi Luang a Buddhist temple in the historic centre of Chiang Mai, Thailand. Its chedi is one of the tallest structures in the old city. There are a lots of important Buddhist holidays take place here. Then you will stroll along small streets lined with traditional houses, where you will take a rickshaw tour. After that, you will take a walking through the central market of Warorot, which is a great spot for travellers wanting to experience the true Thai culture and daily life. In the afternoon we cannot miss the Doi Suthep hill. The mountain’s temple is one of the most historically and spiritually significant places in Thailand. We drive up the scenic mountainous terrains and pass by lush landscapes on your way to the base of the complex. We then climb up for more than 300 staircase and finally take an elevator to the top. Here get your chance to admire the picturesque panorama views of Chiang Mai City. Return to the hotel and you can relax or enjoy going to the night market by your own.

Chiang Mai – Elephant Nature Park Your day begins with a morning pick-up from your Chiang Mai hotel (8:00–8:30 am) and a scenic transfer to the Elephant Nature Park. After a warm welcome and an introduction to the sanctuary’s conservation efforts, you’ll prepare food for the elephants, including chopping fruits and crafting nutritious banana rice balls. Enjoy a guided walk through the forest alongside the elephants, feeding them bananas and observing their natural behaviours, such as foraging, tree-rubbing, and swimming. A delicious vegetarian buffet lunch by the riverside provides a relaxing break before you return to the project site. Conclude your visit with an afternoon trip to the park to see the resident herds up close, returning to Chiang Mai around 4:00–4:30 pm. This family-friendly experience is suitable for ages 7+, with moderate walking involved. Please bring comfortable clothing, walking shoes, sunscreen, bug repellent, and a refillable water bottle.
Chiang Mai / departure The day will be free on own until you’ll be driven to the airport for your next destination flight. Tour ends!
